item.title: COMP7802 Topic 1 Financial Modeling and Basic Financial Arithmetic
item.description: COMP7802 Introduction to Financial Computing Topic 1.1 Financial Modeling Model: Abstraction towards some Objectives. Financial Model Financial Objectives (what-if question) Risk Return … Abstraction (represent in mathematical terms) Asset Price Interest Rates Volatilities … Financial Modeling Process Define Financial Objectives Identify Input & Output Variables Construct Financial Model Design Solution & Implement Processing Logic Output Presentation & Validation Topic 1.2 Basic Financial Arithmetic Interest Rate

item.title: ECO108 Topic 1 Ten Principles of Economics
item.description: Introduction to Economics The word economy comes from the Greek work oikonomos, which means “one who manages a household”. Economics is the study of How society manages its scarce resources. Topic 1 Ten Principles of Economics Principle 1: People Face Trade-Offs One classic trade-off - “guns (national defense) and butter (consumer goods)”. Another trade-off - efficiency and equality. Principle 2: The Cost of Something Is What You Give Up to Get It
